ovdesc.p: This application stores information of all the Securities for which the Price/Yield is updated Manually. Information stored is New Price, Old Price, Bid Price, Offer Price, Income, Accumulated Income, Price change Date, User ID & Date & Time of changes done.

The information in fields TIME.CHANGE, NEW.PRICE, OLD.PRICE, INCOME, ACCUM.INCOME is updated during the Authorisation of a modification to a Security master record. Records can also be created and amended manually, at which time all fields can be input.

An archive facility is available to archive data in this file to SC.PRICE.CHANGE$ARC. This will be based on the date in ARCHIVE table, record 'SC.SEC.ARCHIVAL', field PURGE.DATE. Any information prior or equal to this date will be archived when Adhoc service SC.INT.ARCHIVAL is run.

ACCR.DIV.RATE

This field is used to input the rate at which the dividend is to be accrued. This rate is then multiplied with the nominal balance on the SECURITY.POSITION of the security The product is then populated in the DAILY.ACCR.DIVIDEND file in the CURR.ACCR.DIV field. This is all done as part of the EOD process for Money Reserve (MRF) and on line for Money Market Fund(MMF).
Input specified by the customer. The amount will be in units.

The Foreign Inclusion Factor (FIF) of an instrument is a weighting assigned to an instrument that represents the proportion of shares outstanding that are deemed to be available for purchase in the public equity markets by international investors. In practice limitations on availablity include:
strategic and other shareholdings in an instrument
limits on foreign ownership.
The FIF is used by companies who compile indexes to provide a more accurate representation of company weighting in the index calculation.
A value between 0 and 1 should be entered.

This field indicates the price condition, as specified by SWIFT, for example CDIV indicates the price is 'cum dividend', XWAR indicates the price is 'ex warrants'. The user should consult the SWIFT manual for a full list of price conditions.
